Params: {3: 'The next morning, everyone gathers on the outskirts of the town.'}
{2: 'Bridget', 3: 'Three vehicles will go with you to the Babel Tower, all fully stocked with ammunition and supplies.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bridget', 3: 'The mayor is looking for me, probably to discuss evacuation plans.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Bridget', 3: 'If you need anything, just talk to "Sand Fox".', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee', 3: 'According to the coordinates, the Babel Tower should be just ahead.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Before your group, as far as the eye can see, lies nothing but ruins.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Dante', 3: "No, there's definitely something here. I can feel it. The demon's right here.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lucia', 3: "The concentration ahead... is indeed slightly higher than surrounding areas, but it's quite mild, still within normal levels.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'You retrieve a weapon shaped like a rocket launcher from one of the Support Force vehicles.'}
{2: 'The Support Force has brought some Omega Weapons.', 3: '43'}
{3: "According to Alpha's previous conjecture, the Mirror Demon may already be an agent-level enemy, perhaps worth attempting to use an Omega Weapon against it."}
{3: 'The Omega Weapon-equipped warhead propels through the air before detonating with a deafening blast, as if colliding with an invisible wall in the distance.'}
{3: 'When the smoke dissipates, a jagged rupture hangs suspended in midair, its edges warping the light around it.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Dante', 3: "So that's its game, hiding behind mirrors. No wonder it's called the Mirror Demon.", 4: '18'}
{2: "Sand Fox, let's give it a few more hits.", 3: '64'}
{3: 'The Support Force members bring out their remaining Omega Weapons, launching multiple warheads simultaneously.'}
{3: 'After this explosion, the opening widens enough for vehicles to pass through, revealing the full view of the Babel Tower.'}

{1: '1', 3: "A cylindrical tower sheathed in Red Tide aggregates looms in the distance, an ominous spire that draws everyone's gaze. Above it, swarms of Hetero-Creatures wheel through the air, their presence dripping with palpable malice."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lucia', 3: 'The Punishing Virus concentration is rapidly increasing!', 4: '18'}
{1: '1', 3: 'A gaunt, middle-aged man stands atop the tower, his gaze fixed on the approaching group in the distance.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Among the group of Constructs, two white-haired men in long coats stand conspicuously apart.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Thomas Hell?', 3: 'Are they... the Sons of Sparda?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Thomas Hell?', 3: "I should've known that other demons would also come to this world.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Its eyes narrow slightly as it recalls the sight—the two Sons of Sparda locked in battle within the Demon World.', 4: '1', 5: '2'}
{3: "Back then, it was just a nameless demon among hell's legions, but now, it has claimed power beyond its former wretchedness."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Thomas Hell?', 3: "But it's too late now. Even the Sons of Sparda cannot stop the power of demons merged with the Ascension-Network.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Thomas Hell?', 3: 'Moreover, I still hold a trump card...', 4: '1'}

{1: '1', 3: "The emaciated man turns, his gaze locking onto the figure looming in the shadows, wreathed in an aura of seething darkness. White hair, a dark blue coat, and... a face identical to Vergil's."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Thomas Hell?', 3: 'A being forged from memories and the Red Tide...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Thomas Hell?', 3: "Hahaha, mirror images are always interesting, aren't they?", 4: '1'}

{1: '1', 3: 'Thomas, who can no longer be called human, waves its hand in a gentle motion. At its command, the swarm of Hetero-Creatures churning in the air surges forward, a writhing tide descending upon the distant group.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Thomas Hell?', 3: 'Kill them all. Leave no survivors.', 4: '18'}
{1: '1', 3: "Having done all this, the man stands motionless, savoring the imminent battle, eagerly awaiting the coming symphony of agonized screams and Hetero-Creatures' shrieks."}
{3: 'Yet, deep within, a flickering consciousness still struggles, and its feeble resistance irritates him.'}
{2: 'Thomas Hell?', 3: 'Your will... is utterly powerless against my power.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'The next moment, a splitting pain lances through its head. Its body crumples to the ground as its face twists in agony, tears spilling over.'}
{2: 'Thomas Hell?', 3: 'Lyca... I have to save Lyca...', 4: '1', 5: '2', 6: '3'}
{3: 'Just as quickly, the anguish fades, replaced once more by that mask of malice.'}
{2: 'Thomas Hell?', 3: "I'll send out some Hetero-Creatures to track down Lyca. I'll bring her back so this body can end it once and for all.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: 'You notice Dante beside you gazing into the distance.'}
{2: 'Dante', 3: "I think someone's up there, at the top.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Lee quickly transforms his composite armaments into sniper mode and peers through the scope at the top of the tower.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee', 3: 'There is indeed someone there. High resemblance to Thomas from our intel.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: "Dante glances at Vergil beside him, then gestures toward the composite armaments in Lee's hand."}
{2: 'Dante', 3: "I've got a similar Devil Arm that can transform into 666 different modes.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lucia', 3: "The Hetero-Creatures are on the move. They're closing in.", 4: '1'}
{2: "The Mirror Demon knows we're here. Prepare for combat.", 3: '245'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Like a plague of locusts, countless Hetero-Creatures swarm toward the convoy.'}

{3: 'Roof-mounted machine guns roar to life, bullets ripping through the horde of Hetero-Creatures. The three transport vehicles lurch forward, tires grinding through gore and shattered limbs as they fight for every inch of ground.'}
{3: 'As the Hetero-Creatures grow in number, Gray Raven leaps into the fray and begins to eliminate the enemies.'}
{3: 'The battle rages on, and now your group has covered half the distance to the Babel Tower.'}
{1: '1', 2: '"Sand Fox"', 3: "We can't keep this up. We're running low on ammo.", 4: '1'}
{2: '"Sand Fox"', 3: 'This is as far as we can go!', 4: '1'}
{3: 'The three vehicles grind to a halt, immobilized. Endless waves of Hetero-Creatures swarm toward you, cutting off any path to the Babel Tower.'}
{2: 'Support Force, you can evacuate from here.', 3: '297'}
{3: 'You turn to look at your companions slashing through the horde and shout.'}
{2: 'Everyone else, prepare to break through! We need a path!', 3: '299'}
{2: 'Dante', 3: 'No need for that. Just stay behind me!'}
{2: 'Dante', 3: "Vergil, time to show them what we're made of!"}
{2: 'Vergil', 3: "You don't get to order me around."}
{3: 'Fierce winds howl, billowing their coats as Dante and Vergil stand side by side, unshaken.'}
{2: 'Vergil', 3: 'I alone am enough to handle this situation.'}
{2: 'Dante', 3: "I'm not letting you have all the fun to yourself."}
{2: 'Vergil', 3: "Hmph. Try to keep up, if you can. I won't wait for you."}
{2: 'Dante', 3: "Feeling confident, huh? Let's see who makes it to the tower's gates first!"}
{3: 'Red and blue particles intertwine, spiraling around the two half-demons.'}
{3: 'Then, a powerful shockwave explodes outward, hurling Hetero-Creatures back like ragdolls.'}
{3: 'Their human appearance vanishes without a trace, giving way to devilish forms as if straight from the depths of hell.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Vergil sheathes his sword as a blue spherical domain envelops the space around him.'}

{1: '1', 3: 'As Judgment Cut End is unleashed, countless slashes carve through the air, leaving only Dante untouched. Each blade mark twists space itself, shattering it like fractured glass, tearing apart every Hetero-Creature within its domain.'}
{3: 'The two half-demons charge toward the Babel Tower simultaneously, tearing through the remaining Hetero-Creatures with relentless speed.'}
